result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy L Porter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Troy L Porter not in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Troy L Porter.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Troy L Porter appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Troy L Porter.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant has completed TAD evaluation and firearm safety course. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Troy L Porter in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Troy L Porter appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Case may be in DPA posture. Discussion held regarding completion of a TAD evaluation.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Troy L Porter in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Troy L Porter in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference/ status of counsel.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Michael Plaisted to represent defendant at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 09/01/2022 and on the first of every month thereafter until paid in full. Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment.
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Troy L Porter in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@0230
